Node.Text: To the roof, if you would.
We haven't met yet. Who are you?
I'm Charles, the groundskeeper here. My daughter is Mr. Lindson's wife... er, was, I guess.
What are your thoughts on Mr. Lindson's death?
Boy, you may want to be a tad less blunt with your questioning. Ah well, I guess it doesn't matter either way.The man was a true entrepreneur, but I can't say he was the best husband.
My daughter told me he was quick to anger, especially with matters concerning money. He always had to be in control.
Why are you going to the roof?
I've gotta fix the shingles. Something's always going wrong around here.
Of course I am! My son-in-law never put in a day of work in his life! He did the bare minimum and left the rest to me. Now I'm stuck with it.
It's been nice chatting with ya. Have a good night.
